intro: Pseudalbizzia coripatensis, commonly known as the Coripata acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often found in rocky soils and mountainous areas. Its flowers are typically yellow or pale green, and it produces legume pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
